etymologies: mid 17th century: modern Latin, from Greek, literally ‘prophet’

definitions: a slender predatory insect related to the cockroach. It waits motionless for prey with its large spiky forelegs folded like hands in prayer.

notes.text: Suborder Mantodea, order Dictyoptera: Mantidae and other families, and many species, including Mantis religiosa, introduced to America from southern Europe and now found commonly in the northeastern US

shortDefinitions: slender predatory insect with triangular head
